Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 45 years old. He is married with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.es:
Fredisminda, solicita un nuevo crédito para facilitar la compra de pollo, repollos, lechuga, leña , etc., ya que son insumos necesarios para seguir trabajando en su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió lo necesario para que su negocio continúe activo y siga  generando los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, su familia goza de mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario. Todos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en: Fredisminda is requesting a new loan to buy chicken, cabbage, lettuce, firewood, etc., which are items she needs to continue working in her food production and sales business. With her previous loan, she purchased the items she needed to keep her business going and to continue earning income that she needs to pay household expenses and to improve her family’s food, health and clothing. She reports that all of her family is healthy.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cabbage, lettuce, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced farmer from Goris city in the Syuniq region. She lives with her daughter, 4-year-old granddaughter and 2-year-old grandson. She works in a private bakery as a baker. She is the main breadwinner of the family. Her salary, however, is not enough to effectively meet her family's needs. To be able to cover those needs, Anahit is also engaged in breeding livestock (a cow and a pig), in beekeeping and in the cultivation of potatoes. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family's income. Her daughter assists her greatly in everyday activities related to farming. 

Anahit currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustained way. She needs a loan of USD 600 to purchase forage (grass and barley) for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Anahit was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Anahit and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping the family to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage (grass and barley) for the livestock.

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en:
Tariro is a 24-year-old single mother of one child living in rural Zimbabwe. Tariro volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a high school in her district teaching students life skills education as a part of Camfed’s My Better World program. Starting in 2009, Tariro has been running a poultry business where she produces about 125 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in in her community. She would very much like to increase her sales and expand her business.

With a Kiva loan, Tariro will purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost her sales. Improving her business will improve her life considerably and she will be able to provide for her child and as well as her dependents and put them through school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 5 children, aged 26, 24, 21,18 and 15. In 1982, Ibrahim established his electronics and jewelery business. He began his business to solve his domestic problems. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy jewelery (1,000,000 SLL), a 21 inch television (1,500,000 SLL) and music sets - 2,500,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his capital base and hence his profit. In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his children and to travel to the holy land of Mecca on a pilgrimage. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr: Créé le 05 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. Madame Aminata (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 28 ans et mère d'un garçon et de deux filles. Elle achète du bois et du charbon de bois, des tissus teintés pour les revendre dans son quartier à un prix plus élevé. Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter un camion de bois à 200000F CFA , 100000F CFA de charbon de bois et 50000F CFA de tissus. Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la scolarisation de ses enfants d’une part et d’autre part à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille aussi renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
Established on May 5, 2007, at the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women who have experience with banc villageois programs. They are all from the same neighborhood and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their primary activity is small business.

Mrs. Aminata (standing at far right with a hand raised [in the photo]) is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 28 years old, and the mother of one boy and two girls. She purchases wood, charcoal, and tinted fabric to resell in her neighborhood for a higher price. With her new loan, Mrs. Aminata plans to purchase a wood truck for 200,000 CFA francs, as well as 100,000 CFA francs of charcoal and 50,000 CFA francs of fabric.

Mrs. Aminata plans to use part of the profits to support her husband in sending their children to school and the rest to improve her family's living conditions as well as to increase her savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: To sell charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, age 34, established her plastic products business in 2006. She began this venture because she wants to help her husband, who was crippled in an accident while he was engaged in running the home. They have four children, ages six, eight, fifteen, and twenty-two. Hawa's business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,560,000 every month from this business.

Hawa would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and her new loan will be utilized to buy additional bathing buckets, food flasks, and plastic plates. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her stock and make more profit. 

In the future, Hawa's goal is to be able to support the costs of her children's education. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bathing buckets, food flasks, and plastic plates.

loans.name: Alpha Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Alpha Bakarr. He is married and has three children aged five, ten and fifteen. In 2009, Alpha Bakarr established his flowers, picture frames, window linings, mats, clocks, Christmas trees, and house decorations business. 

He began his business in order to be self reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,141,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alpha Bakarr has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional Christmas decorations. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. 

In the future, Alpha Bakarr plans to improve the business and expand to a shop. He started the business selling for his brother, and he now owns his own. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for Christmas decorations

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Sallay.  She is married and has three children aged four, seven and thirteen.  She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores.  In 2003, Sallay established her dry fish business.  She began her business to help her husband with running the home.  Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are women.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 544,190 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Sallay requires a loan in order to buy fish.  She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profit.  In the future, Sallay plans to expand the business to imported rice.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en:
Aghasi is a farmer from Stepanavan city in the Lori region. He lives with his wife. Aghasi works as a driver in the private sector. He is the main breadwinner of the family. Unfortunately his salary alone is not enough to cover the daily expenses of his family. He is also engaged in agribusiness to be able to take care of his family. 

With the help of his wife he is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture and in breeding pigs. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. As life is getting more expensive with time, Aghasi wants to expand his agribusiness a little bit to more effectively meet his family's needs. To reach that goal, he needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase three steers, and to buy some forage for the cattle. 

As this is Aghasi’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Aghasi and his wife will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase three steers and to buy some forage for them.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado,  él continua con la venta de carne de cordero, res, pollo, vacuno y porcino. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Hernan sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de cordero, chancho, pollo, pescado y otros más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  

Hernan nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Hernan  is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan and he is happy about the assistance.  He continues selling lamb, beef, chicken, and pork.  He has been doing this work for several years and things have been going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Hernan continues to belong to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and he needs this loan to buy lamp, pork, chicken, fish, and other things.  He is grateful and values this loan and is committed to making his monthly payments responsibly and on time.

Hernan was born in the city of Paucartambo, within the Cusco department and lives with his family in this beautiful city.  He is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children that he gets ahead.

loans.use: to buy meats.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marvin es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado, desde hace 10 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos a este.
Don Marvin necesita el préstamo para la compra de más vacas para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho  en la economía de su hogar. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con las reces necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes más en estas épocas navideñas que sus clientes le encargan mucho producto.
 Don Marvin gracias a esta inversión espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del  2013
texts.en:
Marvin is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with his family in a southern Honduras community.  He has been buying and selling livestock in his town and nearby for ten years out of his home.

Marvin needs a loan to buy more cattle to continue his work, which helps him very much financially.  He expects this loan to be very helpful to him, since he doesn’t have the cattle he needs to cover his orders, especially during these Christmas holidays when he gets many customer orders.

Marvin will be able to improve his family’s quality of life and increase his income with the help of this loan.  He expects his business to grow in a short time and continue to support his family.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions and toiletries.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 25-year-old young woman, married with one child. She lives in Nkayi, a district in central Zimbabwe. She is well-known in her community for volunteering at community centers and using her passion to help orphans and vulnerable children. 

Precious operates a dressmaking business sewing school uniforms and selling them to residents and schools in her community. She has been in the business for eleven months and employs one person. In addition to earning a livelihood, Precious also strives to create more employment in her community.

Precious will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, thread, and fabric. This will enable her to produce more clothing and as a result improve her business. In turn, this will allow her to support her family members and put herself through school.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has two children, ages three and five. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help with her education. 

In 2005, Rugiatu established her baby clothing business. She began her business to be self-reliant, after dropping out of school. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 529,875 every month from this business. 

Rugiatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to add napkins, diapers, baby oil, and pampers to her stock. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand the business to a shop. She started the business by selling for a sister, now she owns her own business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for napkins, diapers, baby oil, and pampers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chains, earrings, bags, and blouses for her business

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is married and has two children. She is from Yenoqavan village of Tavush region. Hermine works as a teacher at the village local school. Her salary, however, is so low, that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. 

Hermine is engaged in cattle and livestock breeding and in cultivation of wheat, grass, and several fruits such as plums, pomegranates, blood oranges, apples, pears, and walnuts. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for the family. 

To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hermine is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase five piglets and forage for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets and forage for cattle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 26-year-old single oman who lives in the town of Shurugwi, Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about empowering young women in her community to overcome the economic hardships that many of them face. She is currently running a poultry business. She started the business in 2012 and currently produces about 130 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in her village. 

The loan will enable her to improve her business considerably. She will purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. An improvement in her business means that she will be able to  provide for her two dependents and put them through school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 18 years old and lives in Matobo District, Zimbabwe. She is an aspiring entrepreneur running a hair autré (hair products shop) in order to become financially independent. She started this business when she was 17 years old after she finished her schooling. She acquired training and experience from working in her friend’s hair salon. She inspires young women in her community as both a community health trainer and an entrepreneur. She would like to move the business to a more central location and increase her clientele base.

The Kiva loan will enable her to open her own hair salon and purchase a hair dryer, rollers, ceramic iron or tongs and hair products needed in her salon. Her hope is to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment and supplies for her hair products shop

loans.name: Getu

texts.en: Getu is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional her grandchildren. She has a business of selling produce and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava, green bananas and onions. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She moves door to door selling and sells to all categories of people seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to sell on a wholesale basis only.  She resides in the family house which has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava, green bananas and onions.

loans.name: Ramatulai

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Ramatulai. She is single and has two children ages 15 and 10 years. In 2007, Ramatulai established her commercial business selling ladies' dresses, blouses, skirts, and so on. She began her business because she wanted to be self-sufficient and to provide for her children’s schooling and welfare. She opens her business seven days a week and 12 hours a day. She earns SLL 1,000,000 from this business every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ramatulai requires a loan in order to buy ladies' blouses, dresses and skirts . She hopes that this loan will increase her profit margin by SLL 700,000. Ramatulai has not yet achieved her goal of opening a dressmaker store or fashion store but is still striving hard to achieve it. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies blouses, dresses and skirts .

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 38 years hold and has six children between the ages of 2 and 16. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 52 years old. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he hopes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters/biogas for resale in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters/biogas for resale in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a biodigester for personal use and also one for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters/biogas for resale in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters/biogas for resale in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters/biogas for resale in his community

loans.name: Noe Reinaldo

texts.es:
Noé, es parte de una familia compuesta por su compañera de vida y un hijo de 24 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y hortalizas, realizando está actividad puede generar los ingresos necesarios para que en su hogar no falte nada.
 Comprará abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, y semillas, tanto para sembrar maíz como para cultivar tomate, pepino, y chiles. Espera tener una producción más grande, una cosecha de mayor calidad, cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener ingresos extras que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Aspira a tener su casa propia para darle a su familia un lugar seguro.
texts.en:
Noé is part of a family made up of his life’s partner and 24 year old son.  He raises basic grains and vegetables and this generates the necessary income so that he is not in need of anything.

He will buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds so he can plant corn, tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers.  He expects to have a larger and better quality production, meet his customer demand, increase his sales, and have extra income that he needs to meet his financial obligations.

He wants to have a home of his own so he can provide a secure place for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 54-year-old married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol, earns a living through her sari-sari or retail business as she sells various goods and items to the people in her community. Her husband works as a farmer.

Lilia is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, biscuits and snack foods as well as fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks and thus attract more buyers. Lilia hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, as well as fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa continua dedicándose a la venta de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, ella  sigue teniendo el pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas para estas épocas de navideña y año nuevo. 

Ella nació en la ciudad de Accha pero ahora vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa continues to sell clothing for men, women and children. She still has her small sales booth at one of the markets of the town of Paucartambo where she sells her products. She has been in this line of work for several years and thanks to her hard work, she does very well. She's a member of the "Mamacha Carmen" communal bank. On this occasion she requests the loan in order to purchase garments such as sweaters, pants and shirts for this Christmas and New Year's season.

She was born in the town of Accha, but she currently lives with her family in the charming town of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco. She's 55 years old and married, and from this relationship she has seven children whom she gets ahead.

loans.use: to purchase garments such as sweaters, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice, palm oil, and cooking oil.

loans.name: María Donata

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 grado, ya que sus padres no quisieron que continuara estudiando, porque mencionaban que eso era algo, en que el tiempo se desaprovechaba. Tiene 4 hijos, quienes estudian y solamente ella cubre con toda la responsabilidad, ya que su esposo desgraciadamente falleció.

María inicio a  trabajar desde los 11 años, ya que acompañaba a sus hermanos mayores a hacer jornales y así aprendió a cortar caña. Ahora, trabaja como ama de casa, desde hace ocho años. Sin embargo, en la época de producción de caña de azúcar, María continua yendo a trabajar. Ademas, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde. Todo este sacrifico lo hace por sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que no les falta nada.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para invertirlo en el negocio de la avicultura, ya que necesita comprar mas pollitos, concentrado, vitaminas y ademas mejorar el equipo, por lo que adquiriría comederos y bebederos.

A María le gustaría construir su casa de un mejor material, ya que en la que habita, es de lamina y en el día la calor impide que puedan estar largo tiempo dentro de ella, y en la noche la temperatura baja y el frio es mucho mayor. Ademas, piensa trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos y que la calidad de vida de ellos pueda mejorar en un futuro.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, left school after the third grade because her parents couldn't afford for her to go farther.  She has 4 children of her own now, all in school.  Maria's husband died, sadly, so she has sole responsibility for the children.  

Maria started working when she was only 11 years old, working day jobs cutting sugar cane with her older brothers and sisters.  She has worked as a house cleaner for the past eight years, but still cuts sugar cane for extra income.  She started a poultry business, as well, more work that she's willing to do because it provides another means to help her children get ahead in the world.

Maria will use this loan to pay for supplies--chicks, feed and vitamins, for example--and make improvements to the feeders and hatcheries where she keeps her chickens.

For the future, Maria would like to rebuild her house with better materials.  Her family lives in a metal shack now, one too hot to live in during the day and only tolerable at night when it's cooler.  She says that she plans to continue working hard in the hope that she can give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothing, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Tamemsu Manepeh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsu Manepeh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 
The featured leader of this group is Kaday.  Kaday is age 51.  She was born in Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is living in Magburaka town with her husband and six children. Her husband is a taxi driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Kaday sells breads and has been selling breads for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a larger quantity of bread to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of bread to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, Maggi, tomatoes, etc., in wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own taxi, rather than continuing to work for someone else.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Isatu. She is married and has three children, who are aged 20, 16 and 13 years. In 2008, Isatu established her groundnut business. She began her business, because she wanted to be gainfully employed by herself and meet her daily needs and wants. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Isatu requires a loan to buy more bags of groundnuts. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 1,000,000. Isatu has opened a special account for her children's welfare. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase drugs to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of plantains.

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
Damián, está necesitando capital para invertir en la compra de dos terneros, para críalos y luego venderlos a sus clientes y de esa manera obtener los ingresos que necesita para seguir cubriendo los gastos familiares.
Con el préstamo anterior compro los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo que su cosecha fue muy abundante, brindo mejor calidad a sus clientes, sus ganancias aumentaron y las ha invertido en  los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Damian needs capital to buy two bulls to raise and then resell to his customers.  In this way he can obtain the income he needs to continue covering his family expenses.

He used the money from the previous loan to buy farming supplies for his corn and bean crops.  His harvest was very abundant, he provided his customers with good quality, his earnings increased, and he used them to pay for his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, es madre de un hijo de 14 años, vive junto a sus padres su hijo, para poder aportar en los gastos familiares se dedica a sembrar granos básicos (maíz y frijol), es una actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que lo hace personalmente desde los 14 años de edad lo hace con ayuda de mozos, su mayor ventaja es que no paga alquiler de del terreno.
Utilizara el préstamo para pagar mano de obra para la recolección de granos básicos, de 8 manzanas de cultivo de maíz y 8 de frijoles. Con lo que espera tener a tiempo la cosecha para trasladarla a su casa donde será distribuida a sus clientes y de esta manera podrá tener mejores ventas, sus ingresos aumentaran.
Sueña con mantener su negocio fortalecido y activo para seguir teniendo ganancias que le faciliten dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y ofrecer una oportunidad de superación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Reina is the mother of a 14 year old boy. She lives with her son and her parents. To be able to help with the household expenses she grows basic grains (corn and beans). She learned this activity from her parents and has been farming for herself since she was 14 with the help of workers. Her main advantage is that she does not have to pay rent for her land.

Reina will use the loan to pay labor to harvest the basic grains, 8 hectares of corn and 8 hectares of beans. What she harvests will be transported to her house where it will be distributed to her customers. This way she can have greater sales and her profits will increase. She dreams of keeping her farm strong and active in order to continue to have income which helps give her family better living conditions and offer her son a way to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his metal shop.

loans.name: Ntombikayise

texts.en:
Ntombikayise is 29 years old and lives in the town of Umzingwane, Zimbabwe. She is married with three children and volunteers at a community dormitory for girls who live too far from their high school to walk to school each day. She has been a community health trainer for six years and volunteers in schools disseminating health information. She is currently running a cattle farm. She sells cattle to local abattoirs and dairy milk to the Umzingwane community. The business has drastically changed her life and has enabled her to put one of her children through school.  

Ntombikayise  will use the Kiva loan to purchase cattle feed and increase her earnings on her dairy and beef sales. She hopes to raise enough money to continue educating her children, herself and to support her ten siblings.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortés.  Tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada como blusas, pantalones, camisas, también cosméticos. Además elabora y vende tamales de maíz con carne. Solicita el segundo préstamo para surtir el negocio, el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras. Con este préstamo va comprar ropa usada como blusas, camisas, camisetas, vestidos, pantalones. Su meta es ampliar el negocio para poder obtener ganancias y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Reina is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the town of Choloma, Cortés and has been selling used clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, and cosmetics for three years.  She also makes and sells corn and beef.  She is asking for this loan of 10,000 Lempiras to stock her business.  She will use the money to buy shirts, dresses, and pants.  Her goal is to grow her business so she can increase her earnings and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of kenkey and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to increase her serving capacity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels so that she can sell greater quantities of smoked fish.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus hijos de 8, 7 y 6 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de contribuir en los gastos familiares se dedica a sus negocio que consiste en una tienda y una granja de pollos, ubicadas en su residencia lo que le facilita estar al pendiente de ambas actividades, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 7:30 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de pollos, azúcar, jabón, maíz, bebidas, etc., con lo que fortalecerá la granja y la tienda, espera responder positivamente a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus ingresos para cubrir las cuotas de la deuda y seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más rentable para cambiar el estilo de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Maria and her husband have three children, 8-, 7- and 6- years old, respectively.  She operates two businesses, a corner grocery and a poultry business.  She runs both businesses from space in her house and yard, so she can easily go back and forth from one to the other.  She generally works from 6:00am to 7:30pm.
Maria will use this loan to buy chickens, sugar, soap, maize, soft drinks, etc.  The investment will allow her to grow the two businesses and meet demand for everything she sells.  Her earnings from the businesses will both cover her debt payments and provide more income for her family.  For the future, Maria wants to make the businesses more profitable so that she can better help those she loves most.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luz Nancy

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante y carismática, a sus 36 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Cuando quedó en embarazo de su primer hijo tomó la decisión de trabajar para adquirir ingresos por cuenta propia y ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, por ello inició una guardería en la que cuida los niños del ICBF y así ha logrado ganarse la vida sin descuidar a su familia y ha generado ingresos suficientes durante los 18 años que lleva en funcionamiento el establecimiento.
Su propósito con el crédito que solicita es realizar unas adecuaciones locativas que le permitan seguir velando por el bienestar de los niños que están a su cargo.
Luz manifiesta que además de generar ingresos para su familia le gusta realizar su actividad porque tiene un sentido social, pues se involucra en la vida de los niños que cuida, brindándoles amor y compañía que en ocasiones no reciben en sus hogares, esto la llena de vida para seguir luchando incansablemente y brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida e inculcarles valores para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luz is a dynamic and charismatic woman. She is 36 years old and has four children that she provides for through a lot of effort and dedication. When she found herself pregnant with her first child, she made the decision to work in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses. She started a daycare where she looks after children from the ICBF [Colombian Institute for Family Welfare] and this has allowed her to earn a living without neglecting her family. She has generated a decent income during the 18 years she has run this business. 

Luz plans to use the loan to carry out some renovations to ensure the continued well-being of the children in her care. She states that besides the fact that this work generates income to support her family, she likes it due to its benefit to society; she is involved in the lives of the children that she cares for, providing them with love and attention that they sometimes don't receive in their own homes. This fills her with life and allows her to continue pushing ahead tirelessly and providing her children with a better quality of life, as well as instilling values in them so that they will be good people.

loans.use: to carry out renovations.

loans.name: Astrid Carolina

texts.es:
Su nombre es Astrid, estudiante administración hotelera. Recurre a este medio para solicitar la ayuda de Kiva debido que se siente muy triste porque no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes debido a que esta pagando mensual cuotas altas  y no le alcanza, quiere continuar y por eso recurre a ustedes para que le den una ayuda con el préstamo ya que ella necesita salir adelante y acabar sus estudios.  Ella se siente muy cómoda con la carrera que escogió y quiere continuar con sus estudios a nivel profesional, entiende que este es el primer paso y que aun faltan muchos por dar, pero esta convencida de que lo puede hacer.
Pide que tengan en cuenta esta solicitud que es esencial para ella, para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y continuar con los compañeros del programa gracias.
texts.en:
Her name is Astrid, a student of hotel administration. She is turning to this method to request help from Kiva because she is feeling very sad since she cannot count on sufficient financial resources because she is paying high monthly fees and these resources are not enough.

 She wants to continue, and because of this she is turning to you for help through a loan since she needs to get ahead and finish her studies. She is very comfortable with her career choice and she wants to continue with her studies at the professional level. She understands that this is the first step and that she still has many to get through, but she is convinced that she can do it.

She asks that you keep in mind this request that is key for her to be able to provide a better quality of life to her family and continue with her program classmates. Thank you.

loans.use: to pay educational costs.

loans.name: Wendy Natali

texts.es: Había una vez una niña  llamada  Natali, ella acababa de salir del colegio, la niña tenía  la esperanza  de ingresar a la educación superior, pero sus sueños no pudieron ser realidad, sus padres  de pocos recursos y con una familia numerosa no pudieron costener sus estudios. Por tal motivo la niña empezó a enviar hojas de vida  para temporada estudiantil, la llamaron de una papelería y librería del sector, Natali aprovechó la oportunidad y fue tan buena vendedora, que el  dueño de la librería la deja trabajando como fija, ella empieza ahorrar y abre una cuenta de ahorros.  Luego de seis meses en la librería y la niña le dice  a su  madre  "mami  quiero estudiar" la mamá le dice: hija hoy pasaron unos jóvenes repartiendo volantes de una institución de educación. El día de descanso se dirigió a aquel lugar con su madre y ve que es lo que quiere, así que ella empieza a estudiar técnico en mercadeo y ventas y el dueño de la librería le dice que la felicita por quererse superar y la deja trabajando medio tiempo, por lo tanto sus ingresos ya no son los mismos, la joven realiza parte de su  carrera pero llega al punto de hacer sus pasantías pero no le queda tiempo para seguir trabajando entonces se  retira de la librería y sus padres le aportan en sus estudios muy poco, es por eso que acude a kiva.
texts.en: Once upon a time there was a girl named Natali. When she finished high school, she had hoped to continue on to higher education, but her dreams did not come true: Her parents, with a large family and few resources, could not pay for her studies. So the girl began sending out her resume to find seasonal student employment. She found a job at a neighbourhood book and stationary store. Natali took advantage of the opportunity and was such a good seller, that the owner had her stay on as a permanent employee. She began to save and opened a savings account. After six months working in the bookstore, the girl told her mother "Mom, I want to study." Her mother replied: "Daughter, today a few young people came by handing out flyers about an institute." On her day off, she went to the school with her mother to decide. That's how she started studying technical marketing and sales. The owner of the bookstore congratulated her for wanting to be successful and he allowed her to continue working part-time. As a result, her income was no longer the same. The girl completed a portion of the program, reaching the part that required her to do an internship. She no longer had time to continue working, so she left her job at the bookstore. Her parents contribute very little to her studies, so she has come to Kiva.

loans.use: pay for her education.

loans.name: Sindy Pamela

texts.es: Sindy, tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella tiene dos años de haber establecido una pulpería donde vende azúcar, arroz, manteca, café, pastas, harina, achinería, pan, refrescos, dulces, churros y otros. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería con mas productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, pastas, refrescos etc. Su meta es mantener en crecimiento el negocio para ayudar al sustento familiar.
texts.en: Sindy, 22, is married and has one child.  She lives in Olanchito, a town in Yoro.  She started a corner grocery two years ago and sells sugar, rice, butter, coffee, pastas, flour, bread, soft drinks, snacks and other merchandise.  She is now applying for a 10,000 lempiras loan that she will use to stock her grocery with products that she will resell.  For the future, Sindy wants to grow the business and establish it as a means of supporting her family.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Yeni Yohana

texts.es: Hola amigos de Kiva, primero que todo Yohana les da las gracias por el apoyo que le han brindado en los dos primeros semestres de su programa de cosmetología y estética,  ya que sin su apoyo no hubiera sido posible estudiar, y afortunadamente ya se encuentra culminando por lo cual es muy importante y de gran ayuda seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes para poderse graduar  y terminar uno de sus sueños  que es ser esteticista y seguirse formado profesionalmente hasta que Dios se lo permita.  Ahora ya ve muy cerca la primera meta de muchas que están por venir, el próximo paso es continuar con el nivel de profesionalización y lograr abrir su propio consultorio.
texts.en: Hello, friends of Kiva. First of all, Yohana gives you thanks for the support that you have offered her in the first two semesters of her program in cosmetology and esthetics, since without your support it would not have been possible to go to school. Fortunately, she is finishing, for which it is very important and a great help for her to continue having your support to be able to graduate and achieve one of her dreams, which is to be an esthetician and continue developing professionally as far as God allows her. Now she sees that the first of many goals is very near, and the next step is to continue with her level of professionalism and manage to open her own office.

loans.use: to pay for education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bread and beverages, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises operates a sari-sari (variety store) in Trinidad, Bohol.  Moises has been in this business for several years. This is the source of his income.

Moises is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings to sell. With this loan, he will be able to increase his inventory and therefore attract more customers. Moises dreams of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que su padre falleció y a él le toco ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, así que tubo que empezar a trabajar. Esta acompañado, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 2 hijas, quines lograron  terminar sus estudios de educación media, gracias a la ayuda de sus padres.

Desde que dejo la escuela, José inicio a trabajar como corralero en una hacienda, le tocaba ordeñar alimentar y cuidar de las vacas. Ahora esta encargado, de vigilar el equipo de bombeo de los cañales. Ahí tiene 15 años de trabajar, sus turnos son de 24 horas continuas de trabajo y 24 horas de descanso.

Con el préstamo se estará ayudando a que  pueda comprar lamina y logre mejorar el techo de su vivienda, el cual a quedado dañada a causa del invierno y de los fuertes vientos que azotan en esta época. 

A José le gustaría continuar estudiando en la educación básica, ya que reconoce que el estudio es muy importante para lograr superarse, también tiene el sueño de tener energía eléctrica en su casa, para que las condiciones de vida mejoren. Pero sabe que solo esforzándose por seguir adelante, lograra cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jose, 51, left school after the 6th grade because his father died and his mother needed his help to make ends meet.  He and his wife, a homemaker, have 2 daughters, both of whom have finished school thanks to help from their parents.  

Jose worked on a ranch after he left school, herding, feeding and tending cattle.  He now inspects pumps for the local irrigation authority.  He's worked there for 15 years and his schedule requires him to work for 24 hours straight with the next 24 hours off.  

Jose will use this loan to pay for materials that he needs to rebuild his roof.  The roof suffered over the winter from strong winds that are common here then.  

Jose would like to finish school because he knows how important education is for getting ahead.  He would also like to install electricity because it would improve his living condition.  He knows, he says, the importance of hard work for meeting your goals.

loans.use: to pay for building materials that he will use to improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 36 años edad y tiene tres hijos. 

Ana Maria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida típica de la región del cusco, ella sigue teniendo su pequeño restaurante o puesto de venta en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, verduras y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Ana María's a hardworking and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead.  She's 36 years old and has three children.

Ana María is grateful to the lenders for the loan and happy about the support.  She still sells traditional food from the Cusco region in her small restaurant or food stall in one of the main markets in the city of Paucartambo.  She has been working in this business for several years now and it's going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her job.

She needs this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, vegetables, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Folly mécanicien auto exerce son activité dans un garage depuis 2010. Mariée, il est père d'un enfant de 05ans scolarisé. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter un appareil mécanique. Il souhaite aménager son garage et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Folly is a car mechanic and has been working in a garage since 2010. He is married and has a five-year old child who attends school. To help his business to progress, he requests a first loan to buy a mechanic tool. He hopes to equip his garage and take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic tool.

loans.name: Jalloh Street Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Jalloh Street” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective  businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abubakarr is the featured leader of this group. A 48-year-old father of five children who are attending primary and secondary school, Abubakarr has been selling fish for many years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock

loans.name: Fungai

texts.en:
Fungai is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Chikomba West where she sells poultry and eggs. She produces about 120 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in her community. Fungai volunteers in schools in her village as a Camfed community health trainer where she spreads information about various health issues. She wants to increase her sales and expand her business. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to purchase more chicks and chick feed to increase her production. An improvement in her business means she will be able to enroll her children in a good school and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Ndaiziveyi

texts.en:
Ndaizivei, a 25-year-old married mother of two, lives in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe where she rents a grocery shop selling items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationary. Ndaizivei inspires young women in her community as both a Cama community health trainer  and as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for two years and has managed to support herself and her children. 

Ndaizivei will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing stocks at her store. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits céréaliers et alimentaires à domicile, madame Améyo âgée de 47ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter un avenir radieux à sa famille(mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 02 enfants). A l’approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de garder ses clients. Améyo désire développer son activité et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Améyo sells cereal and food products from home. She is 47 years old and struggles every day to offer a radiant future to her family. She is married to a driver and has two children. Just before the end of the year festivities she requests a second loan to buy merchandise in order to keep her customers. Améyo would like to develop her business and take care of her family's health.

loans.use: To buy cereal and food products.

loans.name: Adévi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale, Adevi a pour mari un imprimeur et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Elle revend ses marchandises dans une boutique et fait sa troisième demande de prêt pour acheter plus produits afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite mieux augmenter son stock et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille. Elle a 50ans avec une ancienneté d'1 an dans l'activité.
texts.en: Adevi sells general food products. She is married to a printer and has four children, three of whom go to school. She sells her merchandise in a shop and requests this third loan to buy more stock in order to meet the demands of her clients. She would like to increase her stock and ensure her family's well-being. She is 50 years old and has been in this business for one year.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia continua dedicándose a la venta de comida y teniendo su pequeño restaurante o pollería donde prepara ricos plato de comida y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos, carne, papas, verduras y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  

Florencia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 28 años edad y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Florencia continues to make a living running a restaurant where she sells delicious meals.  The business is going well and, on this occasion, Florencia is applying for a loan in order to buy more supplies, such as chicken, meat, potatoes, vegetables and other items.  Florencia is part of the "Mamacha Carmen" communal bank and she is grateful for and knows the value of this loan.  Florencia promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

Florencia is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is prospering.  She is 28-years-old and has one son.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chickens, meat, potatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Djekra

texts.fr: Djekra mécanicien auto exerce son activité dans un garage depuis 2000. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants de 02ans et 1an. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des pièces détachées. Il souhaite aménager son garage et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Djekra is an automobile mechanic and has worked in a garage since the year 2000. He is married with two children of two years and one year. To help his business to progress, he requests a first loan to buy spare parts. He hopes to equip his garage and take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Cruz es una mujer pujante y activa, madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar, luego de atravesar por un difícil momento tras la separación de su esposo.
Durante 8 años trabajó como empleada doméstica en la casa de unos padres salesianos, pero en el año 2012 se le presentó la oportunidad de tomar en subarriendo un local que estaba acreditado para vender comidas rápidas, ella lo tomó y poco a poco lo fue convirtiendo en charcutería e incluyó la venta de licor, pues la zona en la que se encuentra ubicado se presta para tal actividad; trabaja sola todos los días de 10 am a 10 pm y los fines de semana recibe el apoyo de una hija; esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
El propósito del crédito es invertir en el negocio, comprando surtido al por mayor (carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, entre otros), esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de sus clientes, logrando aumentar las ventas y el margen de ganancias.
Cruz tiene como meta conservar su negocio, acreditarlo y posicionarlo en el sector, para que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica con la que pueda sacar adelante a su hija menor y brindar mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz is a vigorous and active woman, mother to 3 children and the head of the household. She suffered a difficult period after separating from her husband. For eight years she worked as domestic help for a house of Salesian priests. 

But in 2012 the opportunity presented itself to sub-lease a shop that is licensed to sell fast food. She took it and little by little has changed it into a deli, including the sales of liquor. The area it is located in is suitable for this activity. She works by herself every day from 10 am until 10 pm and on week-ends one of her daughters helps her. She learned the business by doing it and it has become the only source of income to support her daughters. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in the business, buying supplies wholesale (cold meats, bread, sauces, soft drinks, beer, liquor, etc.). This will allow her to meet the demands and varied tastes of her customers, managing to increase her sales and margin of profit. Cruz's goal is to hold on to her business, make it well-known and position it in the local market, so that it is profitable. This will guarantee her financial stability which she can get her younger daughter ahead and offer a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (cold meats, bread, sauces, soft drinks, beer, liquor, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se decidió por otro crédito por que necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y semilla, para sembrar y  tener una buena cosecha con granos de calidad y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro concentrado para la ganadería y adquirir una vaca, lo que le ayudo a tener un negocio muy fortalecido, mejoro sus ventas, cuenta con clientes más satisfechos, sus ventas mejoraron y su economía es más estable.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan as he needs to buy manure, fertilisers, insecticides and seeds in order to sow his land and have a good harvest, have quality grains and thus fulfil his customers' orders.

José used his previous loan to buy cattle feed and to buy a cow.  This helped him to strengthen his business and improve his sales.  His customers are more satisfied and his financial situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilisers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Melanea

texts.es: Melania es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, la cual le ha permitido salir adelante con los planes familiares. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que cuenta con su negocio próspero y diversificado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: azúcar, arroz, aceite, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer los productos que más demanda la clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cumplir con sus planes y crecer su mercadería.
texts.en: Melania is originally from the city of Estelí.  She is a businesswoman and owns a grocery store, which has allowed her to do well with her plans for her family.  Melania is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito and she has a prosperous business and has diversified her product range.  Melania is applying for a loan in order to buy sugar, rice, oil and more, so that she can sell the products that are most in demand.  Melania believes that the loan will be of great help to her as she will be able to carry out her plans and expand her range of products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil and more.

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a 28-year-old woman, staying in Wedza district. She is married and a mother of one. She is an entrepreneur. 

Sinikiwe is currently running a beverage store, selling refreshments in her local town. She started the business when she was 20 years old, after realizing that she needed to be economically empowered to succeed in anything in her community. She inspires other young women in her community.

Sinikiwe will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing stocks at her store. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and to provide for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her beverage store.

loans.name: Mata De Palma 1 Group

texts.en:
Gisela is the coordinator of the group "Mata de Palma en Desarrollo" group 1 (Palm tree in development). They are named this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes five micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Gisela is very excited to receive her 15th loan with Esperanza International, after having repaid her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about eight years. She started it when she took her first loan. Gisela plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women accessories)

loans.name: Chuguexalense Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuguexalense,” located in a very remote rural area of Chichicastenango, Guatemala, is composed of eight women whose average age is 39 years. The average number of children that the women have is four. Most of them have not completed primary school and are hungry for new knowledge. The ladies mainly work in textile production. They weave and embroider beautiful handmade traditional textiles. They are requesting loans to purchase additional supplies and grow their businesses.

Rosenda is a 27-year-old married member of the Trust Bank. She has three children who range in age from four to seven years. Rosenda and her husband are business partners. She is a weaver and makes beautiful traditional handmade blouses called “huipiles.” Her husband is a tailor and sews t-shirts, shirts and pants. Rosenda has expanded her business so that she can help her husband cover househould expenses. Rosenda is requesting a new loan with Friendship Bridge in order to purchase several colors of thread for her weaving and fabrics for her husband’s textile business. Both of them want to take advantage of the year-end holidays and meet the increased demand from their customers.

There are many benefits, besides loans, offered to clients in a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. As Rosenda has been a client for several years, she has participated in the monthly trainings which have focused on topics like business administration, money management, women’s health, children’s education, self-esteem and nutrition. As she has not had very much education, these trainings are vital to her growth and the success of her family and business life.

Rosenda, along with her fellow Trust Bank members, wants to express her appreciation to Kiva investors throughout the world. The financial capital that they receive in the form of small loans is received with much gratitude. These loans, combined with the educational trainings, expand so many opportunities for these women. Empowered, they can step into a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: To purchase several colors of thread and fabrics to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his boat and increase the amount of nets, thus allowing him to increase his fishing capacity.

loans.name: Panajachelense Group

texts.en:
From Panajachel, Guatemala we present the Friendship Bridge trust bank Panajachelense (meaning "people from Panajachel"), which was established about five years ago. Currently it is made up of eight women looking forward with positivity. Panajachel is a touristy place and many local people, such as these ladies, are engaged in commerce. Most of the members of this group are engaged in selling clothes, perfumes, cosmetics, jewelry, and food.

One of the group’s members since the beginning is Luisa, 52 years old. She had no opportunity to attend school even for a single day. She married very young and had a total of 12 children, whom she and her husband pulled forward. Currently her two youngest children depend on her. For this reason she is devoting her time to various economic activities such as selling perfumes, jewelry, and clothing. She also owns a small shop for daily consumption. Luisa intends to use the year-end holiday to sell a bit more. She is applying for a new loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy products such as perfumes, new jewelry designs, and seasonal clothing to fill more of her shop. Luisa is positive that she will do very well in her sales, so she will make a bit more income. She will be able to save some money for her children’s inscription fee and uniforms for next year, as they will start fifth and eighth grades.

These women have an average age of 35. Most of them did not reach high school. They appreciate the opportunity of the loans given by Kiva investors through Friendship Bridge, as it helps them engage in productive activities and generate income for their families. They want to support their husbands and move forward together, providing a better life for their children, and above all, provide them the opportunity of development through education.

loans.use: To buy products such as perfumes, jewelry, and seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso de Huaycan” 09 socios responsables y trabajadores, la cual pasan a su 08 ciclo. Angélica una madre emprendedora de 40 años casada con 05 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, negocio que viene siguiendo junto con su pareja. Esto le ha permitido seguir mejorando cada día. Su siguiente préstamo lo destinará para la compra de piezas de repuestos de motos. El anhelo de Angélica es de mejorar su negocio. El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso de Huaycan” agradece por colaborar en su progreso. Angélica se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color verde y en brazos lleva a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
The group "Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" are 9 responsible and hard-working associates who are applying for an eighth loan. Angelica is 40 years old and married. She is an entrepreneurial mother with 5 children, 2 of which are still dependents. She makes a living selling replacement parts for motorcycles, a business that she continues together with her partner. This business has allowed her to continue improving her life. This next loan would be for the purchase of motorcycle replacement parts. Her dream is to improve her business. 

The group "Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" is grateful for the collaboration in their progress. Angelica is seated, first from the left in a green polo and carrying her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Celeny De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Celeny es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, madre de 4 hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente día a día para darles sustento y educación.
Hace algunos años inició su propio negocio, una cafetería en la que ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, alimentos fritos, gaseosas, entre otros, adicionalmente vende mercancía y productos por catálogo, con el fin de complementar los ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Su actitud positiva y su carisma le han permitido ser reconocida en el sector, esto influye en su negocio, pues aumenta las ventas.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, tennis) e insumos para la cafetería (verduras, granos, pastas, entre otros), esto le permitirá capitalizar sus actividades y podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a su clientela y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades, dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en el nivel de utilidades que obtiene.
Celeny tiene como proyecto para un futuro cercano, hacer crecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le permita generar más ingresos para poder construir su casa en material, pues se encuentra en obra negra; asó logrará ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y disfrutar un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Celeny is a thriving and hardworking woman. The mother of 4 children, she works tirelessly day after day to sustain and educate them. A few years ago Celeny launched her own business, a café offering breakfast, lunch, fried foods and sodas. She also sells merchandise and catalog products, which complement her earnings and help her support her husband with the household expenses. 

Celeny's positive attitude and charisma have made her well-recognized in her area, which influences her businesses by increasing her sales. She would like to invest the loan she had requested into the purchase of merchandise (jeans, shirts and tennis shoes) from wholesalers; and into supplies like vegetables, grains and pasta for the café. This will enable her to capitalize on her activities by offering a greater variety to her customers which will satisfy their wants and needs. The result of this will be an increase in her sales and in her earnings. 

One project Celeny has for the near future is to grow her business so that it is profitable and permits her to increase her earnings to the point where she will be able to build a permanent structure for her home, which is now made out of temporary materials. This will improve her family's quality of life and they will enjoy a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (jeans, shirts, tennis shoes) in bulk, as well as supplies for her café such as vegetables, grains and pasta.

loans.name: Ma. Anabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Anabelle is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Ma. Anabelle operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place.
Ma. Anabelle is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like noodles, canned goods, soda and coffee, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales and profit.  In the future, Ma. Anabelle hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like noodles, canned goods, soda and coffee, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Malungu's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Magadju est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Pendeza », entrepreneur, âgée de 24 ans  et mère de 3 enfants, qui 2 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse de poulets et des œufs.   Elle installe ses marchandises  dans le marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 40 poulets et 50 plaquettes d’œufs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
